content: Despite there being a shell.nix available, nix was killing me, so I'm compiling lean4 in a devcontainer. Is there any interest in upstreaming that .devcontainer for lean4?
(Ah, for leanprover/lean4 itself - unless that devcontainer compiles lean from source?)
If it exists it would be in the main lean4 repository

That was my first thought - I did go to check and didn't see any, which led me to believe either:

  • There was no interest in having a devcontainer.
  • No one has bothered yet.

I mainly made this thread to ask if there was any interest in upstreaming the devcontainer I quickly made over to leanprover/lean4, though I did forget to specify 'new' in 'a devcontainer' :+1:
I previously added .gitpod config to the main lean4 repository, so supplying a devcontainer as well seems natural
(especially if GitPod is turned down as they keep threatening to do)
